Package ohos.media.audio

Class AudioCapturer

  • java.lang.Object
    • ohos.media.audio.AudioCapturer

  • public class AudioCapturer
extends Object
    Provides interfaces for applications to implement PCM audio recording and pausing functions.

    This class provides the record and stop interfaces to record and pause PCM audio. The initial parameters of this class are included in the AudioCapturerInfo class.

    Since:
    1
    SystemCapability
    SystemCapability.Multimedia#AUDIO

        public AudioCapturer​(AudioCapturerInfo audioCapturerInfo,
                     AudioDeviceDescriptor devInfo)
              throws IllegalArgumentException
        A constructor used to create an AudioCapturerInfo instance with specified information about the audio streams and input device.
        Parameters:
        audioCapturerInfo - Indicates information about the audio streams to record.
        devInfo - Indicates information about the preference input device of this AudioCapturer.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Throws this exception if a parameter is invalid.
        Since:
        2

      • getMinBufferSize

        public static int getMinBufferSize​(int sampleRate,
                                   int channelCount,
                                   int audioFormat)
        Obtains the minimum buffer size (in bytes) required in the specified conditions.
        Parameters:
        sampleRate - Indicates the sampling rate (Hz).
        channelCount - Indicates the audio channel count.
        audioFormat - Indicates the audio data format.
        Returns:
        Returns the minimum buffer size (in bytes); returns -1 if an exception occurs.
        Since:
        1

      • addSoundEffect

        public boolean addSoundEffect​(UUID type,
                              String packageName)
        Adds a sound effect for audio recording.
        Parameters:
        type - Indicates a sound effect type, which can be SoundEffect#SOUND_EFFECT_TYPE_EC, SoundEffect#SOUND_EFFECT_TYPE_GC, and SoundEffect#SOUND_EFFECT_TYPE_NS.
        packageName - Indicates an application package name.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the sound effect is added; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        1

      • getSelectedDevice

        public AudioDeviceDescriptor getSelectedDevice​()
        Obtains information about the audio input device.

        This method is used to obtain the input device information specified using the AudioCapturer(ohos.media.audio.AudioCapturerInfo) method. The input device may be different from the recording device.

        Returns:
        Returns information about the audio input device.
        Since:
        1

      • getCurrentDevice

        public AudioDeviceDescriptor getCurrentDevice​()
        Obtains information about the device that is recording audio.

        This method is used to obtain the audio recording device configured using the AudioCapturer#AudioCapturer(AudioCapturerInfo, AudioDeviceDescriptor) method.

        Returns:
        Returns device information if any device is recording audio; returns null otherwise.
        Since:
        1

      • getAudioTime

        public boolean getAudioTime​(Timestamp timestamp,
                            Timestamp.Timebase timebase)
        Obtains a Timestamp on demand.

        The Timestamp reflects the frame delivery information at the earliest point available in the capture pipeline.

        Parameters:
        timestamp - a caller provided non-null Timestamp instance.
        timebase - one of Timestamp.Timebase#BOOTTIME or Timestamp.Timebase#MONOTONIC, used to select the clock for the Timestamp time.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the timestamp get successfully; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        3

      • start

        public final boolean start​()
        Starts audio recording.
        Returns:
        Returns true if audio recording is started successfully; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        1

      • read

        public int read​(byte[] data,
                int offset,
                int size)
        Reads audio data from the audio hardware.
        Parameters:
        data - Indicates the audio data.
        offset - Indicates the offset (in bytes) of the audio data.
        size - Indicates the size (in bytes) of the audio to be read.
        Returns:
        Returns the size (an integer from 0 to size) of the audio data if the data is read successfully; returns one of the following error codes otherwise: ERROR_BAD_VALUE indicates a parameter error. ERROR_INVALID_OPERATION indicates that the AudioCapturer instance is not initialized. ERROR_DEAD_OBJECT indicates that the AudioCapturer instance is abnormal.
        Since:
        1

      • read

        public int read​(byte[] data,
                int offset,
                int size,
                boolean isBlocking)
        Reads audio data from the recording hardware device and writes the data into a byte array.
        Parameters:
        data - Indicates the byte array into which the audio data to be written.
        offset - Indicates the offsets (in bytes) for writing the audio data.
        size - Indicates the size (in bytes) of the audio data to be read.
        isBlocking - Specifies whether this method blocks until all the requested data is read.
        Returns:
        Returns the size of the audio data read from the device, which ranges from 0 to size; returns one of the following error codes otherwise:
        1. ERROR_BAD_VALUE: An input parameter is incorrect.
        2. ERROR_INVALID_OPERATION: The AudioCapturer instance is not initialized.
        3. ERROR_DEAD_OBJECT: The status of the AudioCapturer instance is abnormal.
        Since:
        3

      • read

        public int read​(short[] data,
                int offsetInShorts,
                int sizeInShorts)
        (Blocking method) Reads audio data from the recording hardware device and writes the data into a short array.
        Parameters:
        data - Indicates the short array into which the audio data to be written.
        offsetInShorts - Indicates the offsets (represented by shorts) for writing the audio data.
        sizeInShorts - Indicates the size (represented by shorts) of the audio data to be read.
        Returns:
        Returns the size of the audio data read from the device, which ranges from 0 to sizeInShorts; returns one of the following error codes otherwise:
        1. ERROR_BAD_VALUE: An input parameter is incorrect.
        2. ERROR_INVALID_OPERATION: The AudioCapturer instance is not initialized.
        3. ERROR_DEAD_OBJECT: The status of the AudioCapturer instance is abnormal.
        Since:
        3

        offsetInShorts - Indicates the offsets (represented by shorts) for writing the audio data.
        sizeInShorts - Indicates the size (represented by shorts) of the audio data to be read.
        isBlocking - Specifies whether this method blocks until all the requested data is read.
        Returns:
        Returns the size of the audio data read from the device, which ranges from 0 to sizeInShorts; returns one of the following error codes otherwise:
        1. ERROR_BAD_VALUE: An input parameter is incorrect.

      • read

        public int read​(float[] data,
                int offsetInFloats,
                int sizeInFloats,
                boolean isBlocking)
        Reads audio data from the recording hardware device to a float array.
        Parameters:
        data - Indicates the float array into which the audio data to be written.
        offsetInFloats - Indicates the offsets (represented by floats) for writing the audio data.
        sizeInFloats - Indicates the size (represented by floats) of the audio data to be read.
        isBlocking - Specifies whether this method blocks until all the requested data is read.
        Returns:
        Returns the size of the audio data read from the device, which ranges from 0 to sizeInFloats; returns one of the following error codes otherwise:
        1. ERROR_BAD_VALUE: An input parameter is incorrect.
        2. ERROR_INVALID_OPERATION: The AudioCapturer instance is not initialized.
        3. ERROR_DEAD_OBJECT: The status of the AudioCapturer instance is abnormal.
        Since:
        3

      • read

        public int read​(ByteBuffer buffer,
                int sizeInBytes)
        (Blocking method) Reads audio data from the recording hardware device and writes the data into the direct buffer. If the buffer is non-direct, returns 0.
        Parameters:
        buffer - Indicates the direct buffer where the audio data to be written.
        sizeInBytes - Indicates the size (in bytes) of the audio data to be read. Set the size to an integral multiple of the frame size.
        Returns:
        Returns the size of the audio data read from the device, which ranges from 0 to sizeInBytes; returns one of the following error codes otherwise:
        1. ERROR_BAD_VALUE: An input parameter is incorrect.
        2. ERROR_INVALID_OPERATION: The AudioCapturer instance is not initialized.
        3. ERROR_DEAD_OBJECT: The status of the AudioCapturer instance is abnormal.
        Since:
        3

      • read

        public int read​(ByteBuffer buffer,
                int sizeInBytes,
                boolean isBlocking)
        Reads audio data from the recrding hardware device and writes the data into the direct buffer. If the buffer is non-direct, returns 0.
        Parameters:
        buffer - Indicates the direct buffer where the audio data to be written.
        sizeInBytes - Indicates the size (in bytes) of the audio data to be read. Set the size to an integral multiple of the frame size.
        isBlocking - Specifies whether this method blocks until all the requested data is read.
        Returns:
        Returns the size of the audio data read from the device, which ranges from 0 to sizeInBytes; returns one of the following error codes otherwise:
        1. ERROR_BAD_VALUE: An input parameter is incorrect.
        2. ERROR_INVALID_OPERATION: The AudioCapturer instance is not initialized.
        3. ERROR_DEAD_OBJECT: The status of the AudioCapturer instance is abnormal.
        Since:
        3

      • stop

        public final boolean stop​()
        Stops audio recording.
        Returns:
        Returns true if audio recording is stopped successfully; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        1

      • release

        public final boolean release​()
        Releases local audio recording object.
        Returns:
        Returns true if local audio is released successfully; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        1

      • setFramePositionObserver

        public void setFramePositionObserver​(FramePositionObserver observer,
                                     int position,
                                     EventHandler handler)
        Sets an observer to listen for the event that the recording progress reaches a specified position.
        Parameters:
        observer - Indicates the observer to set.
        position - Indicates the recording position.
        handler - Indicates the event handler to invoke the observer. If you do not specify a handler, the default one will be used.
        Since:
        4

      • setFrameIntervalObserver

        public void setFrameIntervalObserver​(FrameIntervalObserver observer,
                                     int interval,
                                     EventHandler handler)
        Sets an observer to listen for the event that the recording progress reaches a multiple of interval.
        Parameters:
        observer - Indicates the observer to set.
        interval - Indicates the audio frame interval.
        handler - Indicates the event handler to invoke the observer. If you do not specify a handler, the default one will be used.
        Since:
        4
